parameters.name: state
parameters.description:
Optional
ACTIVE by default when not specified

parameters.name: pagination.limit
parameters.description:
Optional
Set to configured default limit if not provided
Maximum limit set in platform config and enforced by services

parameters.name: fqns
parameters.description:
Required
Fully Qualified Names of attribute values (i.e. https://<namespace>/attr/<attribute_name>/value/<value_name>), normalized to lower case.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description:
Optional
ACTIVE by default when not specified

parameters.name: pagination.limit
parameters.description:
Optional
Set to configured default limit if not provided
Maximum limit set in platform config and enforced by services

parameters.name: valueId
parameters.description: option (buf.validate.oneof).required = true; // TODO: enable this when we remove the deprecated field

parameters.name: attributeId
parameters.description: option (buf.validate.oneof).required = true; // TODO: enable this when we remove the deprecated field

ActionStandardAction.title:
- STANDARD_ACTION_DECRYPT: Deprecated
Migrate to 'read' action name
 - STANDARD_ACTION_TRANSMIT: Deprecated
Migrate to 'create' action name

values.description:
Optional 
Attribute values (when provided) must be alphanumeric strings, allowing hyphens and underscores but not as the first or last character.
The stored attribute value will be normalized to lower case.

fqnAttributeValues.title: map of FQNs to complete attributes and the one selected value

commonActiveStateEnum.title: buflint ENUM_VALUE_PREFIX: to make sure that C++ scoping rules aren't violated when users add new enum values to an enum in a given package

createdAt.title: created_at set by server (entity who created will recorded in an audit event)

updatedAt.title: updated_at set by server (entity who updated will recorded in an audit event)

commonMetadata.title: Struct to uniquely identify a resource with optional additional metadata

commonMetadataUpdateEnum.title:
- METADATA_UPDATE_ENUM_UNSPECIFIED: unspecified update type
 - METADATA_UPDATE_ENUM_EXTEND: only update the fields that are provided
 - METADATA_UPDATE_ENUM_REPLACE: replace the entire metadata with the provided metadata

policyAction.title: An action an entity can take

keyMode.title: Specifies how the key is managed (local or remote)

publicKeyCtx.title: Specific structure based on key provider implementation

privateKeyCtx.title: Specific structure based on key provider implementation

active.title: active by default until explicitly deactivated

subjectExternalSelectorValue.title:
a selector for a field value on a flattened Entity Representation (such as
from idP/LDAP)

subjectExternalValues.title:
list of comparison values for the result of applying the
subject_external_selector_value on a flattened Entity Representation
(Subject), evaluated by the operator

policyCondition.title:
*
A Condition defines a rule of <the value at the flattened 'selector value'
location> <operator> <subject external values>

booleanOperator.title: the boolean evaluation type across the conditions

policyConditionGroup.title: A collection of Conditions evaluated by the boolean_operator provided

pem.title: x509 ASN.1 content in PEM envelope, usually

kid.title: A unique string identifier for this key

alg.description:
A known algorithm type with any additional parameters encoded.
To start, these may be `rsa:2048` for encrypting ZTDF files and
`ec:secp256r1` for nanoTDF, but more formats may be added as needed.

policyKasPublicKey.title:
Deprecated
A KAS public key and some associated metadata for further identifcation

policyKasPublicKeySet.title:
Deprecated
A list of known KAS public keys

id.title: the database record ID, not the key ID (`kid`)

sourceType.title: The source of the KAS: (INTERNAL, EXTERNAL)

keys.title: Asymmetric keys associated with this KAS

name.title:
Optional
Unique name of the KAS instance

policyKeyMode.description:
Describe how the kas private key is managed.
If the key mode is LOCAL, then the kas private key is stored in the database.
This could be encrypted or unencrypted.
Remote means that the kas private key is stored in a remote key system like KMS or HSM
and all operations are done by the remote key system.

name.title:
used to partition Attribute Definitions, support by namespace AuthN and
enable federation

active.title: active by default until explicitly deactivated

limit.title:
Optional
Set to configured default limit if not provided
Maximum limit set in platform config and enforced by services

nextOffset.title:
Calculated with request limit + offset or defaults
Empty when none remain after current page

remote.title: kas public key url - optional since can also be retrieved via public key

cached.title: public key with additional information. Current preferred version

policySourceType.description:
Describes whether this kas is managed by the organization or if they imported
the kas information from an external party. These two modes are necessary in order
to encrypt a tdf dek with an external parties kas public key.

 - SOURCE_TYPE_INTERNAL: The kas is managed by the organization.
 - SOURCE_TYPE_EXTERNAL: The kas is managed by an external party.

policySubjectConditionSet.description:
A container for multiple Subject Sets, each containing Condition Groups, each
containing Conditions. Multiple Subject Sets in a SubjectConditionSet are
evaluated with AND logic. As each Subject Mapping has only one Attribute
Value, the SubjectConditionSet is reusable across multiple Subject Mappings /
Attribute Values and is an independent unit.

attributeValue.title: the Attribute Value mapped to; aka: "The Entity Entitlement Attribute"

subjectConditionSet.title: the reusable SubjectConditionSet mapped to the given Attribute Value

actions.title: The actions permitted by subjects in this mapping

policySubjectMapping.title:
Subject Mapping: A Policy assigning Subject Set(s) to a permitted attribute
value + action(s) combination

policySubjectMappingOperatorEnum.title:
- SUBJECT_MAPPING_OPERATOR_ENUM_IN: operator that returns true if a value in a list matches the string
 - SUBJECT_MAPPING_OPERATOR_ENUM_NOT_IN: operator that returns true if a value is not in a list that is matched by
string
 - SUBJECT_MAPPING_OPERATOR_ENUM_IN_CONTAINS: operator that returns true if a value in a list contains the substring

conditionGroups.title: multiple Condition Groups are evaluated with AND logic

grants.title:
Deprecated
list of key access servers

active.title: active by default until explicitly deactivated

@type.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com. As of May 2023, there are no widely used type server
implementations and no plans to implement one.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.
